Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian pottery eye bowl; interior: glazed (mostly fired red); exterior: black band at rim; black eyebrow and eye (iris fired mostly red) directly above four red-brown bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Written in pencil on interior: NA4. For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.1037.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.459)
